sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Shell fire and smoke in Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The second phase of the war has been declared by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Israel's armoured columns have swept into the strip and it seems there's no turning back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Israel claims to have struck 450 Hamas targets, including command and control centres.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We are advancing at the war level according to the plan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We are expanding gradually the ground operation and our forces' attack on the Gaza Strip." Hamas has hit back with its own videos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They say the pictures show its rockets being fired at Israel in what it describes as a response to the massacres against civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Han Yunis, in the south of the Gaza Strip, they picked through the rubble of buildings bombed by Israel looking for survivors. The Hamas-controlled health ministry updated the death toll for Gaza on Sunday, saying more than 8,000 men, women and children have been killed in three weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Tel Aviv, families of some of the 230 hostages snatched on October 7th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hamas is now offering to swap civilian hostages for Palestinians jailed in Israel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: As the Israeli Prime Minister met some of the families, his government dismissed the Hamas is more and more clean, the chances of bringing it to a situation where it will agree to come to solutions that will allow us to reach your loved ones, our friends, our loved ones and our loved ones." But far from seeing Benjamin Netanyahu and his ministers as saviors, many in Israel, including hostage families, blame their hardline posture towards Palestinians for precipitating the crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Israel has withdrawn its diplomats from Turkey after its president told a huge rally in Istanbul the Israeli government was behaving like a war criminal and trying to eradicate Palestinians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan claimed a million and a half people attended the pro-Palestinian rally in the Turkish capital on Saturday. Israel's foreign minister Eli Cohen said he was re-evaluating his country's relations with Turkey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Delegates from 65 countries are in Malta for a two-day summit on Ukraine. It's the third meeting

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: since Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky suggested a peace formula at the G20 in August 2022. Russia wasn't invited and China opted out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Topics included food, energy and nuclear security. It comes as Russia accused Ukraine of attacking Kursk nuclear power plant, pictured here in 1996, with drones. Russia said it shot them down but claims a nuclear storage facility was damaged by debris the International Atomic Energy Agency says it was informed and has checked radiation levels in Ukraine seven people were injured when Russia shelled the hair saw a region while there have been reports of explosions in occupied Crimea Ukraine claims some of its drones evaded Russian air defenses thousands of people have rallied in central Madrid to protest against a proposed amnesty for those who joined a failed push for Catalan independence six years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Acting Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez proposed the pardon as he tries to secure another term in office. The Spanish Socialist Workers' Party leader needs the support of Catalan separatist parties which are demanding the amnesty in exchange for backing him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Sánchez has less than a month to win enough votes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Canadian-American actor and star of Friends, Matthew Perry, has died.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He was 54. Perry was reportedly found dead at his Los Angeles home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The police say they're not treating his death as suspicious.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: NBC, which aired all ten seasons of Friends, said in a statement, he brought so much joy to hundreds of millions of people around the world with his pitch-perfect comedic timing and dry wit. His legacy will live on through countless generations.
